item.title: Learning Chmod Permissions in 30 Seconds
item.description: Scary about “drwxr-xr-x”? Don’t worry, in 30 seconds you’ll be able to read it! Chmod always contains three groups, the first is (u)ser, then (g)roup and finally (o)ther (public) -|rw-|r--|r-x | 1 | 2 | 3 | u | g | o (u)ser: user can (r)ead and (w)rite (g)roup: user in this same group can (r)ead. (o)thers/public: can (r)ead and e(x)ecute. U = User (1) G = Group (2) O = Other (Public) (3) R = Read W = Write X = Execute Give permisions: chmod ugo+rwx hey.
